skill.name: lovable
skill.description:
Integration skill for Lovable.dev projects. Activates when working with:
- Lovable.dev projects with GitHub sync
- Supabase Edge Functions that need deployment
- Database migrations for Lovable Cloud
- Projects with supabase/ directory structure
- Any mention of "Lovable", "deploy edge function", "apply migration"

Provides exact Lovable prompts for backend operations that can't be done via GitHub alone.
skill.summary:
Integration skill for Lovable.dev projects. Activates when working with:
- Lovable.dev projects with...
skill.author: 10K-Digital

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing only markdown reference files. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or filesystem access beyond reading its own documentation files. The skill provides contextual guidance for working with Lovable.dev projects.

content.value_statement: Lovable uses two-way GitHub sync for frontend but requires Lovable prompts for backend operations. This skill provides exact prompts for deploying edge functions, applying migrations, and managing database operations without memorizing documentation.
actual_capabilities: Generate exact Lovable prompts for edge function deployment
Provide database migration and RLS policy prompts
Detect secret requirements from codebase patterns
Generate project structure maps for faster navigation
Guide workflow for GitHub to Lovable sync
Support both Lovable Cloud and own Supabase backends
limitations: Does not execute deployments automatically (yolo mode is separate skill)
Does not access Lovable API directly
Requires user to copy-paste prompts into Lovable chat

use_cases.title: Deploy backend changes
use_cases.description: Get exact prompts to deploy edge functions and apply migrations after making code changes

use_cases.title: Manage database operations
use_cases.description: Create tables, add RLS policies, and manage database relationships through Lovable prompts

use_cases.title: Configure project setup
use_cases.description: Run init command to generate CLAUDE.md with project context, secrets tracking, and deployment workflows

prompt_templates.title: Create table
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a profiles table with columns: id (uuid), email (text), name (text), created_at (timestamp)

prompt_templates.title: Add RLS policy
prompt_templates.prompt: Enable RLS on profiles allowing users to only read and update their own rows where user_id = auth.uid()

output_examples.input: I created a new edge function called process-payment. How do I deploy it?
output: Note: If you changed environment variables, also run: "Redeploy edge functions to pick up new secrets"

best_practices: Always commit and push to main branch before deployment
Track secrets in CLAUDE.md to avoid runtime errors
Test edge functions locally before deploying to Lovable
anti_patterns: Deploying from feature branches (only main syncs with Lovable)
Creating tables directly in Supabase dashboard (use Lovable prompts instead)
Forgetting to apply migrations after pushing to GitHub

faq.question: Which Claude tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude Code and Claude. It activates automatically when working with Lovable projects.

faq.question: What backend types are supported?
faq.answer: Both Lovable Cloud (fully managed by Lovable) and own Supabase (direct dashboard access) are supported.

faq.question: How do I automate deployments?
faq.answer: Enable yolo mode for browser automation. This requires the Chrome extension and runs deployments automatically after git push.

faq.question: Is my code safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a documentation-only skill. It never executes code, accesses production systems, or sends data externally.

faq.question: Why do I need prompts instead of direct deployment?
faq.answer: Lovable manages backend infrastructure. Frontend syncs via GitHub but backend operations require prompts for security and validation.

faq.question: How is this different from Supabase CLI?
faq.answer: Supabase CLI works for your own Supabase. For Lovable Cloud, you must use Lovable prompts since Lovable manages the infrastructure.
